verses.verse: (Gen. 11:31; 2 Kin. 19:12; Is. 37:12) Haran, Canneh, Eden, the merchants of (Gen. 25:3) Sheba, Assyria, and Chilmad were your merchants.
These were your merchants in choice items—in purple clothes, in embroidered garments, in chests of multicolored apparel, in sturdy woven cords, which were in your marketplace.
“The (Ps. 48:7; Is. 2:16) ships of Tarshish were carriers of your merchandise. You were filled and very glorious (Ezek. 27:4) in the midst of the seas.
Your oarsmen brought you into many waters, But (Ps. 48:7; Jer. 18:17; Acts 27:14) the east wind broke you in the midst of the seas.

“Your ((Prov. 11:4)) riches, wares, and merchandise, Your mariners and pilots, Your caulkers and merchandisers, All your men of war who are in you, And the entire company which is in your midst, Will fall into the midst of the seas on the day of your ruin.
The (Ezek. 26:15) common-land will shake at the sound of the cry of your pilots.
“All (Rev. 18:17) who handle the oar, The mariners, All the pilots of the sea Will come down from their ships and stand on the shore.

They will make their voice heard because of you; They will cry bitterly and (1 Sam. 4:12; 2 Sam. 1:2; Job 2:12; Lam. 2:10; Rev. 18:19) cast dust on their heads; They (Esth. 4:1, 3; Jer. 6:26; Jon. 3:6) will roll about in ashes;
They will (Is. 15:2; Jer. 16:6; Ezek. 29:18) shave themselves completely bald because of you, Gird themselves with sackcloth, And weep for you With bitterness of heart and bitter wailing.
In their wailing for you They will (Ezek. 26:17) take up a lamentation, And lament for you: (Ezek. 26:4, 5; Rev. 18:18) ‘What city is like Tyre, Destroyed in the midst of the sea?
‘When (Rev. 18:19) your wares went out by sea, You satisfied many people; You enriched the kings of the earth With your many luxury goods and your merchandise.
But (Ezek. 26:19) you are broken by the seas in the depths of the waters; (Ezek. 27:27) Your merchandise and the entire company will fall in your midst.
(Is. 23:6; Ezek. 26:15, 16) All the inhabitants of the isles will be astonished at you; Their kings will be greatly afraid, And their countenance will be troubled.
The merchants among the peoples (Jer. 18:16; Zeph. 2:15) will hiss at you; (Ezek. 26:2) You will become a horror, and be no (Ps. 37:10, 36; Ezek. 28:19) more forever.’ ” ’ ”
(Proclamation Against the King of Tyre) The word of the LORD came to me again, saying,

“Son of man, say to the prince of Tyre, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “Because your heart is (Jer. 49:16; Ezek. 31:10) lifted up, And (Is. 14:14; 47:8; Ezek. 28:9; 2 Thess. 2:4) you say, ‘I am a god, I sit in the seat of gods, (Ezek. 27:3, 4) In the midst of the seas,’ (Is. 31:3; Ezek. 28:9) Yet you are a man, and not a god, Though you set your heart as the heart of a god
(Behold, (Ezek. 14:14; Dan. 1:20; 2:20-23, 28; 5:11, 12; Zech. 9:3) you are wiser than Daniel! There is no secret that can be hidden from you!
With your wisdom and your understanding You have gained (Ezek. 27:33; Zech. 9:1-3) riches for yourself, And gathered gold and silver into your treasuries;
(Ps. 62:10; Zech. 9:3) By your great wisdom in trade you have increased your riches, And your heart is lifted up because of your riches),”
‘Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Because you have set your heart as the heart of a god,

Behold, therefore, I will bring (Ezek. 26:7) strangers against you, (Ezek. 7:24; 21:31; 30:11; Hab. 1:6-8) The most terrible of the nations; And they shall draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom, And defile your splendor.
They shall throw you down into the (Is. 14:15) Pit, And you shall die the death of the slain In the midst of the seas.
“Will you still (Ezek. 28:2) say before him who slays you, ‘I am a god’? But you shall be a man, and not a god, In the hand of him who slays you.
You shall die the death of (1 Sam. 17:26, 36; Ezek. 31:18; 32:19, 21, 25, 27) the uncircumcised By the hand of aliens; For I have spoken,” says the Lord GOD.’ ”
(Lamentation for the King of Tyre) Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

“Son of man, (Ezek. 27:2) take up a lamentation for the king of Tyre, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: (Ezek. 27:3; 28:3) “You were the seal of perfection, Full of wisdom and perfect in beauty.
